model: Rocket Cordless Stick Vacuum (IX140 / IZ140 / IX141)
seo_keywords: Shark rocket brush roll not spinning

problems.title: Vacuum is not picking up debris / No suction
problems.description: The vacuum motor is running but it is not picking up dirt, or the suction feels very weak. The nozzle light might be red.
possible_causes: Blockage in the floor nozzle, wand, or handheld unit
solution_steps: Empty the dust cup.
Check filters to see if they need cleaning. Rinse and completely air-dry for at least 24 hours.
Check the floor nozzle for blockages and clear if required.
Remove the wand and check for blockages at both ends.
Check the 'Clog Access' on the wand (if applicable) and clear debris.

problems.title: Brushroll does not spin
problems.description: The vacuum is on, but the roller at the bottom is not turning. The nozzle light may be red or off.
possible_causes: Vacuum is not tilted back far enough
Connection issue between nozzle, wand, and handheld
Boost mode usage on area rugs
solution_steps: Immediately turn off the vacuum.
Remove any string, carpet fibers, or hair wrapped around the brushroll (use scissors if needed).
Ensure the handheld vacuum is tilted back far enough to engage the brushroll.
Disconnect and reattach the wand and floor nozzle to ensure a solid electrical connection.
If vacuuming area rugs, make sure you are not using Boost mode.

problems.title: Vacuum turns off on its own
problems.description: The unit shuts down unexpectedly during use.
possible_causes: Vacuum is overheating due to blockages
solution_steps: Check battery indicator lights. If low, charge the vacuum.
Empty dust cup and clean filters.
Check wand, accessories, and inlet openings for blockages.
Allow unit and battery to cool for at least 45 minutes to reset the thermal thermostat.
Restart with the power switch.

problems.title: Battery Indicator Lights are Flashing
problems.description: The LED lights on the handheld vacuum are blinking in specific patterns.
possible_causes: Bottom LED flashing: Battery needs charge
Top and Bottom LEDs flashing: Battery temperature not optimal
Top 2 or Bottom 2 LEDs flashing: System error
solution_steps: If bottom light is flashing: Charge the battery immediately.
If top and bottom lights are flashing: Leave battery plugged in; charging will resume once temp normalizes.
If Top 2 or Bottom 2 lights are flashing: This indicates a call to Customer Service is needed (or replace the battery).

problems.title: Vacuum lifts area rugs
problems.description: The suction is too strong and is pulling up rugs.
possible_causes: Suction is too high for delicate rugs
solution_steps: Turn off Boost mode (release the trigger).
Use the selector switch to ensure you are not on 'Carpet' mode if the rug is delicate.
